page.title: 03THE VILLAGE OF SALPERTON
page.content: At one end of the village there is a group of farm buildings including several Cotswold stone barns and one Dutch Barn,stacked with hay.Dry stone walls line the lanes and divide one property from another.There are two splashes of red:one is the letter-box and the other the single mellow red brick wall of a house whose other three walls are of cotswold stone.Beside the letter-box is a telephone kiosk and the nearby house has the name 'THE OLD POST HOUSE' on the gate .A stone carving of a bell over another doorway ,with the words 'OLD BELL,1752' is another relic of the past.Today there is neither post office nor public house.
